required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Relative Bioavailability Study to Investigate and to Compare Two Different Formulations of Hyoscine Butylbromide in Healthy Male and Female Volunteers
clinical_study.official_title: Relative Bioavailability Study to Investigate and to Compare Two Different Formulations of Hyoscine Butylbromide, Following Oral Administration in Healthy Male and Female Volunteers (an Open-label, Randomised, Single Dose, Two-way Crossover, Phase I Study)

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of the current trial is to establish the bioequivalence of 2 hyoscine butylbromide dose forms following oral administration.

primary_outcome.measure: Maximum Measured Concentration of the Hyoscine Butylbromide in Plasma (Cmax)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pharmacokinetic samples were collected pre dose at 2 hour (h) and at 0.5, 1, 1.5, 1.75, 2, 2.25, 2.5, 2.75, 3, 3.5, 4, 6, 8, 10, 14, 24 and 36 h after the drug administration.
primary_outcome.description: Cmax, maximum measured concentration of the hyoscine butylbromide in plasma.

primary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Concentration-time Curve of the Hyoscine Butylbromide in Plasma Over the Time Interval From 0 to the Last Quantifiable Data Point (AUC0-tz)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pharmacokinetic samples were collected pre dose at 2 hour (h) and at 0.5, 1, 1.5, 1.75, 2, 2.25, 2.5, 2.75, 3, 3.5, 4, 6, 8, 10, 14, 24 and 36 h after the drug administration.
primary_outcome.description: AUC0-tz, area under the concentration-time curve of the hyoscine butylbromide in plasma over the time interval from 0 to the last quantifiable data point

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Concentration-time Curve of the Hyoscine Butylbromide in Plasma Over the Time Interval From 0 Extrapolated to Infinity (AUC0-∞ )
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pharmacokinetic samples were collected pre dose at 2 hour (h) and at 0.5, 1, 1.5, 1.75, 2, 2.25, 2.5, 2.75, 3, 3.5, 4, 6, 8, 10, 14, 24 and 36 h after the drug administration.
secondary_outcome.description: AUC0-∞, area under the concentration-time curve of the hyoscine butylbromide in plasma over the time interval from 0 extrapolated to infinity

arm_group.description: drops, oral administration with 240 mL water
sugar coated tablets, oral administration with 240 mL water

intervention.description: sugar coated tablets for oral administration

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
1. Healthy male and female subjects
Exclusion criteria:
1. Any relevant deviation from healthy conditions

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Randomised, single-dose, open-label, two-way crossover trial in healthy volunteers to investigate and compare the relative bioavailability of two formulations of hyoscine butylbromide administered orally as drops (T: test treatment) or as sugar-coated Buscopan® tablets(R: reference treatment).
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: All subjects were screened for eligibility to participate in the trial. Subjects attended specialist sites which would then ensure that all subjects met all inclusion/exclusion criteria. Subjects were not to be randomized to trial treatment if any one of the specific entry criteria were not met.

group.title: Buscopan® Tablet (R)/Hyoscine Butylbromide Drops (T)
group.description: Participants administered orally in the morning on Day 1 of period 1 with single dose of 2 sugar-coated tablets of 10 milligram (20 mg) of Buscopan®, followed by 20 mg hyoscine butylbromide drops with dose strength of 2 millilitre (mL) in the morning on Day 1 of period 2, each treatment with 240 mL water. Both treatment periods were separated by a wash-out period of at least 7 days.

group.title: Hyoscine Butylbromide Drops (T)/Buscopan® Tablet (R)
group.description: Participants administered orally in the morning on Day 1 of period 1 with 20 mg hyoscine butylbromide drops with dose strength of 2 millilitre (mL) orally, followed by single dose of 2 sugar-coated tablets of 10 milligram (20 mg) of Buscopan® in the morning on Day 1 of period 2, each treatment with 240 mL water. Both treatment periods were separated by a wash-out period of at least 7 days.

baseline.population: Treated Set (TS) :The TS includes all subjects entered in the trial and treated with at least one dose of study medication.

group.title: Buscopan® Tablet (R)/Hyoscine Butylbromide Drops (T)
group.description: Participants administered orally in the morning on Day 1 of period 1 with single dose of 2 sugar-coated tablets of 10 milligram (20 mg) of Buscopan®, followed by 20 mg hyoscine butylbromide drops with dose strength of 2 millilitre (mL) in the morning on Day 1 of period 2, each treatment with 240 mL water. Both treatment periods were separated by a wash-out period of at least 7 days.

group.title: Hyoscine Butylbromide Drops (T)/Buscopan® Tablet (R)
group.description: Participants administered orally in the morning on Day 1 of period 1 with 20 mg hyoscine butylbromide drops with dose strength of 2 millilitre (mL) orally, followed by single dose of 2 sugar-coated tablets of 10 milligram (20 mg) of Buscopan® in the morning on Day 1 of period 2, each treatment with 240 mL water. Both treatment periods were separated by a wash-out period of at least 7 days.

measure.title: Race (NIH/OMB)
measure.description: Ethnicity was not captured in this trial.

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Maximum Measured Concentration of the Hyoscine Butylbromide in Plasma (Cmax)
outcome.description: Cmax, maximum measured concentration of the hyoscine butylbromide in plasma.
outcome.time_frame: Pharmacokinetic samples were collected pre dose at 2 hour (h) and at 0.5, 1, 1.5, 1.75, 2, 2.25, 2.5, 2.75, 3, 3.5, 4, 6, 8, 10, 14, 24 and 36 h after the drug administration.
outcome.population: Descriptive statistics is based on treated set (TS) and statistical analysis is based on pharmacokinetic (PK) analysis set (PKS). (PKS includes all treated subjects with data for a primary endpoint and without any protocol violation relevant to the statistical evaluation of PK endpoints.)

group.title: Hyoscine Butylbromide Drops (T)
group.description: Participants administered orally single dose of 20 mg hyoscine butylbromide drops with dose strength of 2 millilitre (mL) with 240 mL water in the morning on Day 1 of period 1 or period 2.

group.title: Buscopan® Tablet (R)
group.description: Participants administered orally single dose of 2 sugar-coated tablets of 10 milligram (20 mg) of Buscopan® with 240 mL water in the morning on Day 1 of period 1 or period 2.

measure.title: Maximum Measured Concentration of the Hyoscine Butylbromide in Plasma (Cmax)
measure.description: Cmax, maximum measured concentration of the hyoscine butylbromide in plasma.
measure.population: Descriptive statistics is based on treated set (TS) and statistical analysis is based on pharmacokinetic (PK) analysis set (PKS). (PKS includes all treated subjects with data for a primary endpoint and without any protocol violation relevant to the statistical evaluation of PK endpoints.)

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: The statistical model, analysis of variance (ANOVA) on the logarithmic scale includes effects: ‘sequence’, ‘subjects within sequences’, ‘period’, and ‘treatment’. The effect ‘subject within sequences’ was considered as random, whereas the other effects were considered as fixed.
analysis.estimate_desc: Standard error of the mean is actually intra-individual geometric coefficient variance [%]. Statistical analysis is based on PKS which includes 27 subjects.

outcome.title: Area Under the Concentration-time Curve of the Hyoscine Butylbromide in Plasma Over the Time Interval From 0 to the Last Quantifiable Data Point (AUC0-tz)
outcome.description: AUC0-tz, area under the concentration-time curve of the hyoscine butylbromide in plasma over the time interval from 0 to the last quantifiable data point
outcome.time_frame: Pharmacokinetic samples were collected pre dose at 2 hour (h) and at 0.5, 1, 1.5, 1.75, 2, 2.25, 2.5, 2.75, 3, 3.5, 4, 6, 8, 10, 14, 24 and 36 h after the drug administration.
outcome.population: Descriptive statistics is based on TS and statistical analysis is based on pharmacokinetic (PK) analysis set (PKS). (PKS includes all treated subjects with data for a primary endpoint and without any protocol violation relevant to the statistical evaluation of PK endpoints.)

group.description: Participants administered orally single dose of 20 mg hyoscine butylbromide drops with dose strength of 2 millilitre (mL) with 240 mL water in the morning on Day 1 of period 1 or period 2.

group.description: Participants administered orally single dose of 2 sugar-coated tablets of 10 milligram (20 mg) of Buscopan® with 240 mL water in the morning on Day 1 of period 1 or period 2.

measure.population: Descriptive statistics is based on TS and statistical analysis is based on pharmacokinetic (PK) analysis set (PKS). (PKS includes all treated subjects with data for a primary endpoint and without any protocol violation relevant to the statistical evaluation of PK endpoints.)

The effect ‘subject within sequences’ was considered as random, whereas the other effects were considered as fixed.

reported_events.time_frame: From the first dose of trial medication until 7 days after the end of treatment period, upto 9 days.

group.title: Hyoscine Butylbromide Drops (T)
group.description: Participants administered orally single dose of 20 mg hyoscine butylbromide drops with dose strength of 2 millilitre (mL) with 240 mL water in the morning on Day 1 of period 1 or period 2.

group.description: Participants administered orally single dose of 2 sugar-coated tablets of 10 milligram (20 mg) of Buscopan® with 240 mL water in the morning on Day 1 of period 1 or period 2.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
